title: Average Star Formation Parameters in the Local Volume of the Universe
abstract:
Based on the fluxes of 1400 nearby galaxies observed in far ultraviolet
(${\rm FUV}$) and in the H$\alpha$ line, we determined the global star
formation rate per unit Universe volume, $j_{\rm SFR}=(1.34\pm0.16)
10^{-2}\,M_{\odot}$ yr$^{-1}$ Mpc$^{-3}$. With the current star formation rate
(SFR), ($65\pm4)$% of the observed stellar mass is reproduced in the
cosmological time of 13.8 billion years. The neutral gas reserves in the Local
Volume with a radius of 11 Mpc will facilitate the current SFR on a scale of
approximately another 5 billion years.
